key_risks: Regulatory and legal challenges, including AML compliance deficiencies and flood insurance violations
Significant exposure to real estate markets, increasing vulnerability to property market downturns
Geopolitical risks due to U.S.-Asia trade focus and U.S.-China tensions
Intense competition from traditional banks and fintech companies
controversies: 2015 enforcement action by the Federal Reserve for AML compliance deficiencies, terminated in 2018
Lawsuits over loan defaults, including a $40 million dispute with Irwin Naturals and a $42 million default involving Canyon Catalyst and Rubicon
social_issues: Commitment to diversity initiatives as part of ESG principles
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and enforcement actions impacting governance practices

sources.title: Fed terminates enforcement action against Pasadena, Calif.-based East ...
sources.snippet: Fed terminates enforcement action against Pasadena, Calif.-based East West Bank July 24, 2018 The Fed 0 An enforcement action initiated in 2015 for "deficiencies relating to compliance" with anti-money laundering requirements has been terminated (as of July 18) against East West Bank, of Pasadena, Calif., the Federal Reserve said Tuesday.

sources.title: Federal Reserve Board issues enforcement action against East West Bank
sources.snippet: The Federal Reserve Board issued an enforcement action against Pasadena, Calif.-based East West Bank for alleged violations of the National Flood Insurance Act. East West Bank was ordered to pay a civil money penalty of $129,108 to the National Flood Insurance Program. The bank neither admitted nor denied the Fed board's findings.
